Body: How can I develop the loRa sx1272 with Arduino UNO? I want to link the arduino to arduino by using the wireless at long range.

Maybe this can help :

  • https://github.com/Lora-net : implementations of LoRa in C
  • http://www.research.ibm.com/labs/zurich/ics/lrsc/lmic.html : LoRa WAN in C v1.5 by IBM

openlora.com/forum can be cool too

"

Maybe this module can help
http://www.netblocks.eu/xrange-sx1272-lora-datasheet/

Also there is a port of Semtech's SX1272 driver http://www.netblocks.eu/downloads/

"

This github: https://github.com/matthijskooijman/arduino-lmic

Is working with arduino and sx1272
column9:
also sx1276. There is a wiki and you can send from node -> node. There is also a wiki how to connect your sx1272

For the moment it is not yet working on LoRaWAN.

"

Body:
here is link of cooking hacks they sell shields, provide drivers and tutorials, I'am using one for raspberry.

https://www.cooking-hacks.com/documentation/tutorials/lorawan-for-arduino-raspberry-pi-waspmote-868-900-915-433-mhz/#step3_4
